intro: Prestonia brittonii, commonly known as the Britton's prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels and feature showy, trumpet-shaped petals in shades of yellow to orange. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
